unnormalised: Energy & Utilities: Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra
normalised: Energy and Utilities: Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra

unnormalised: Mumbai, November 16, 2023 - Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming to enhance grid efficiency and reduce power theft. As of today, over 5 lakh smart meters have been installed in urban and rural areas, with a target of reaching 20 lakh by the end of FY24.
normalised: Mumbai, November sixteen, two thousand and twenty three - Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution C O. L T D. (M S E D C L) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming to enhance grid efficiency and reduce power theft. As of today, over five lakh smart meters have been installed in urban and rural areas, with a target of reaching twenty lakh by the end of F Y twenty four.

unnormalised: The initiative aligns with the central government's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), which envisions pan-India smart metering. MSEDCL officials reported a noticeable decrease in Aggregate Technical and Commercial (AT&C) losses in areas where smart meters are operational.
normalised: The initiative aligns with the central government's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S), which envisions pan-India smart metering. M S E D C L officials reported a noticeable decrease in Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses in areas where smart meters are operational.

unnormalised: "Consumers are also benefitting from improved billing accuracy and real-time energy consumption data accessible through the MSEDCL mobile app," stated Mr. Patil, Chief Engineer, MSEDCL, during a press conference held at 11:00 hrs today.
normalised: "Consumers are also benefitting from improved billing accuracy and real-time energy consumption data accessible through the M S E D C L mobile app," stated Mister Patil, Chief Engineer, M S E D C L, during a press conference held at eleven zero zero hours today.

unnormalised: Challenges remain, including logistical hurdles in remote areas and public awareness campaigns to address concerns about data privacy. A stakeholder meeting is scheduled for December 5, 2023, at Vidhan Bhavan to discuss these issues and strategize for Phase II of the project, slated to commence on 15/01/2024. The project entails an investment of Rs. 5000 crore.
normalised: Challenges remain, including logistical hurdles in remote areas and public awareness campaigns to address concerns about data privacy. A stakeholder meeting is scheduled for December fifth, two thousand and twenty three, at Vidhan Bhavan to discuss these issues and strategize for Phase two of the project, slated to commence on fifteenth January two thousand and twenty four. The project entails an investment of rupees five thousand crore.
